   Assessment and Plan: 89 year old male with a history of COPD,
   hypertension, chronic kidney disease, aortic insufficiency and
   congestive heart failure who was found down in his living [**Apartment Address(1) **] days
   prior to admission.  Here he was found to have odontoid and right wrist
   fractures, transferred from TSICU for hypoxic and hypercarbic
   respiratory failure.  Here he is more stable from respiratory
   standpoint but active issues are now low grade fevers, leukocytosis of
   unclear origin, and delirium.
   .
   #)  Fevers/leukocytosis: Patient is intermittently febrile and now has
   a rising leukocytosis.  Cultures have not grown anything to date, but
   he has persistently been on antibiotics.  This could be from gout.  C
   diff NTD and pending from this morning.  CXR appears unchanged.  LFTs
   normal.  Has completed a course of Azithro, and have changed to Zosyn
   (empiric coverage of Pseudomonas), and continuing Vanco (for MRSA
   coverage).
   - Continuing Vanc/Zosyn
   -  F/u cultures, continue to re-culture if spikes (all are NTD, sputum
   culture is contaminated)
   - Needs new sputum Cx as the last one was inadequate
   - Rheum recommends  Colchicine for gout treatment; no steroids at this
   time.
   - He has had a left-sided pleural effusion for several days.  Consider
   tapping if persistently febrile.
   - R PICC was just placed [**2109-11-4**] so not likely source.  Will consider
   pulling if we can obtain other access.
   - Would add Flagyl for anaerobes if persistently febrile and no source
   becomes apparent
   - Stopped tylenol and was afebrile
   .
   #) Congestive Heart Failure: Concern for exacerbation of end stage
   diastolic heart failure complicated by severe AR and moderate MR in the
   setting of IV fluid resuscitation and holding home medications.
   - Have started Lasix 40 IV bid
   - metoprolol 37.5 mg QID
   - I/O goal
   .
   #) AFib with RVR: dig loaded, level was 1.8 yesterday pm, only getting
   dosed every day. Will discuss on rounds starting on qday dosing.
   - Dose with digoxin today; was held yesterday d/t 1.8 Dig level
   - Metoprolol as above
   - INR very high yesterday, will convert and stop coumadin.
   - F/u coags this am
   .
   #) Hypoxic and Hypercarbic Respiratory Failure: Has not had episodes of
   desaturation for several days but continues to require frequent
   suctioning.
   - Vanc/Zosyn as above.
   - diuresis
   - continue albuterol and ipratropium nebulizers
   - titrate O2 as needed to maintain sats.
   - Continue as is, try to wean O2 as tolerated
   .
   #) Delerium: more interactive the last couple of days but continues to
   wax and wane quite a bit.  He is able to communicate with his sons and
   they think he has improved.  Almost definitely has hospital/ICU
   delirium.
   - Should continue working with PT.
   - Standing Tylenol for pain control
 will give a trial off Tylenol to
   assess fevers
   - no benzos or other altering medications
   .
   #) Gout: Rheum consulted and tapped knee, fluid is consistent with
   gout. Could explain low grade fevers, increased WBC count.
   - Continues on Prednisone 2.5mg PO qday and we are hesitant to increase
   this further, pt already with delirium and possible infection
   - Started Colchicine yesterday
   - Has been on prednisone despite rheum recs not to be on it, will
   discuss with team today.
   .
   #) Hypotension: resolved.  Will need close monitoring while being
   diuresed.
   .
   #) Left and right wrist fractures: Left side reduced and casted.  Right
   side splinted.  No plans for operative intervention.
   - will recontact ortho to take a look at the L cast which appears to be
   sliding off
   .
   #) Dens Fracture:  [**Last Name (un) 10782**] Type II dens fracture.  Non-operative.
   Currently in [**Location (un) 2420**] J Collar.
   - Touched base with orthopedics who said needs to keep on 6-8wks from
   injury and then f/u with Dr. [**Last Name (STitle) 10823**]
   - Q4H neurologic checks
   .
   #) Chronic Kidney Disease: Baseline creatinine 1.4-1.6.  Currently
   improved to 1.1
   - trend creatinine
   .
    #) Anemia: Baseline hematocrit in the high 30s, today 23.3.  Had large
   bleed several days ago from fem line site, none since.  Appears on labs
   to be anemia of chronic disease.
   - trend hematocrit with transfusion goal < 21
   .
   #) COPD: Unclear history.  Patient has a history of CO2 retention at
   baseline and uses home oxygen at 2L.  He does not take inhalers at home
   but has been prescribed them in the past.  We are giving albuterol and
   ipratropium nebulizers standing
   .
   #) Benign Prostatic Hypertrophy: holding agents while he has foley in
   place
    .

Summary of Progress Note:
- The patient is an 89-year-old male with a history of COPD, hypertension, chronic kidney disease, aortic insufficiency, and congestive heart failure.
- He was found down in his living apartment days prior to admission and had odontoid and right wrist fractures.
- The patient transferred from TSICU for hypoxic and hypercarbic respiratory failure and is currently more stable.
- Active issues include low-grade fevers, leukocytosis of unclear origin, and delirium.
- The patient has been intermittently febrile and now has a rising leukocytosis. Cultures have not grown anything to date, but he has persistently been on antibiotics.
- He completed a course of Azithromycin and was changed to Zosyn (empiric coverage of Pseudomonas), and continuing Vancomycin (for MRSA coverage).
- The patient's left-sided pleural effusion needs to be tapped if persistently febrile.
- He will continue on Vanc/Zosyn, re-culture if spikes (all are NTD, sputum culture is contaminated), and needs a new sputum culture.
- Rheum recommends Colchicine for gout treatment; no steroids at this time.
- He has had a left-sided pleural effusion for several days. Consider tapping if persistently febrile.
- His congestive heart failure is a concern for exacerbation of end
